docs.snippet: In 15 years with the Cincinnati Bengals, Ken Riley somehow intercepted 65 passes — the fifth most in league history — quietly enough to avoid induction in Canton, Ohio....
docs.lead_paragraph: In 15 years with the Cincinnati Bengals, Ken Riley somehow intercepted 65 passes — the fifth most in league history — quietly enough to avoid induction in Canton, Ohio.
docs.abstract: Samuel G Freedman Box Seats article charges that Ken Riley's omission from Pro Football Hall of Fame stands as one of its most striking oversights; recalls that in 15 years with the Cincinnati Bengals, Riley intercepted 65 passes--the fifth most in league history.

headline.main: Omission of Bengals’ Riley From Hall of Fame Is a Striking Oversight
headline.print_headline: In Need of Fame for the Hall

docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Bill Parcells becomes first NFL coach to be inducted into Pro Football Hall of Fame in seven years; only coach to take four franchises to the playoffs, Parcells won two Super Bowls with New York Giants; other football news noted.

headline.main: Joining Hall of Fame, Parcells Appreciates Kinship of N.F.L.

docs.snippet: With the closing of Philadelphia’s Germantown High, a victim of budget cuts, its football players have to set aside a long-held animosity to join rival Martin Luther King High....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the closing of Philadelphia’s Germantown High, a victim of budget cuts, its football players have to set aside a long-held animosity to join rival Martin Luther King High.
docs.abstract: Football players from Philadelphia's now-defunct Germantown High, victim of budget cuts, have to set aside long-held animosity to join rival Martin Luther King High; few could have imagined these schools merging and these teams playing as one, but austerity has trumped rivalry.

headline.main: An Involuntary Union of Football Rivals for Philadelphia High Schools
